content: Nice....but copy/paste needs work. Moving & copying from one source to another is not simple. This app does read all sources (external/internal). I gave this a try on my Samsung Tab s6 because it will not read my Seagate usb 3.0 drive. This app allowed access to the drive.
replyContent: The most likely cause of the failure is a the tablet not supplying enough power to the HDD.  This usually happens with physically large drives (more platters == more power).  You can usually fix this with a powered (PD) USB hub.

replyContent: UME default mode is single select.  You can enabling multiple or a range select from the menu.  UME is media focused and it's file manager is just one of it's features.  Also, UME supports a much wider range of devices than ES.

content: The OTG USB adapter I have also has a micro USB that still allows charging of the phone while in use. Or at least it's supposed to. While this App mounts the USB flash drive and allows data transfer, if does not allow power to flow to the phone through the OTG adapter. So while your flash drive is connected you will not be able to charge your phone even if your OTG cable has a micro USB port for power as well.

replyContent: NMI was designed for mass storage devices (e.g. card readers and flash drives).  Some cameras emulate these, but Canon and Nikon do not.  If you use a card reader, it should work.

content: This software seems to be working and performing most of the task that are required. I wanted something that would allow me to transfer files to my thumb drive and free up some space on my Nexus 7. This software did just that. It allows me to stream videos from my thumb drive as opposed to having to transfer them back to the Nexus 7 to watch. However, my major complaint is that there are no thumbnail images for the videos. When I have the transfer of screen to open, the one that shows the files on my Nexus and the files transferred to my thumb drive, I can see thumbnail images for the videos on my Nexus 7, but those same videos do not have thumbnail images on the side showing the files on my thumb drive. This is kind of a bummer. I would think that this would be an easy fix. It's an mp4 file. I am Not sure at this point if it was worth the money that the app costs.
replyContent: Generating thumbnails is a surprisingly heavy weight process.  Android stores thumbs for local files in a special database.  Those thumbs are not copied to the drive.  The Video screen has an option to generate thumbnails.  The 8.1 release will have an option to specify which scene (in seconds to use).

...be aware that video content appears to be streamed through a localhost URL and I found that it wouldn't play streamed into Moboplayer 2 or similar if the file names had spaces in (as URL paths don't). Once you have that sorted then plugging a USB otg cable in with a microsd card works as treat.

replyContent: Usually intermittent connection issues indicate a bad OTG cable.  In rare cases it can be a bad microUSB port.  It can also happen with hard drives if it is not getting enough power.

replyContent: 1) Some USB Players have a FAT emulation mode (called something like AV Connect).  Usually it's enabled by holding the eject button with the door open.  2) Most likely the phone does not supply enough power for the hard drive.  I can't fix that.  You can try a powered USB hub as described here.  http://homesoft.info/nmi/hdd.shtml

Works perfectly with my nexus 5 , can able to connect my n5 with Samsung HDD M3 1 Tb without any power source .

Using with Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 and a WD Passport with a 'y' style OTG to watch movies and play music on tablet. Love the app, but on my 2013 nexus 7 there's always the same problem: whenever i copy an amount of files from usb to my device, every single copied file appears in the notifications bar as "succesfully copied" i cannot stress enough how annoying this gets when i copy a couple hundred photos. The notifications just keep coming long after the copying is done, even after i shut down and restart my nexus... Please fix this, simple bug...
replyContent: Go to the Preferences and uncheck "Use Download Manager".  FYI: This should be set off by default.

content: Good app, makes file transfers possible from your mini USB port and USB storage device both ways. content: Great work!

Don't use anything else. This was able to detect my USB right away on my Nexus 5. Tested with jpg, mp4, and docx. files with no troubles. Worth every penny (especially for the Nexus 5, which gives you the option to have expandable storage).

Also, it can not read exFat format and can not recognise my 64gb USB stick even though its NTFS formatted. Luckily, there is an app that manages successfully all of the above - USB Stick plugin for Total Commander! Exfat, NTFS - read and write.
replyContent: NMI can write to drives formatted as FAT32, but unfortunately not NTFS.

content: NMI imported video file for me from an NTFS formatted USB stick, but then I found the audio codecs wouldn't work. Not NMI's fault but frustrating. The video quality looked OK.  FAT32 is not so bad after all.

Awesome software. Works like a charm with card readers. But, unfortunately, not all readers are supporting, sometimes popular ones. My transcend Reader is not working, but a cheap local brand is working. Strange. Anyway, 5 stars!  But other file explorer has given free otg support and importer. So, its time for nmi to go free.
replyContent: There are some issues with the Snapdragon 600 (Nexus 7 and Moto X) where some devices just are not recognized.  Usually these are off-brand devices, but there are a few name brands that do not work.  If you contact me via "Email Developer" or tap "Homesoft" from the "About" screen I can give the list I have.

content: Doesn't do what expected and what it says. waste of money. Just use normal file manager works just as good.

If you contact me via "Email Developer" or tap "Homesoft" from the "About" screen we can discuss what part of the app description you found confusing.

content: This does what it says it does, manages files from an external memory using an OTG cable. No root just plug in and see your drive and read and write to and from it.   Others , and I tried a few were awefull and did nothing.
Must have app to use OTG without root your device.

I had high hopes for this software, but it can't keep up with video. I got too many stalls during playback. It happened about a dozen times within a ten minute view. The company contacted me about a couple of suggestions, but they didn't work (task killer running).  Update:  All my movies have been ripped the same way. It appears that some will not work correctly. Not sure why. Others are fine. Not sure what to make of it yet, but the company is working with me.
replyContent: The video may not have been muxed for streaming.  If it's MP4, check for an option called HTTP Fast Start or interleave delay (500ms) in the tool that created it.  If you can send me the file container (mp4, mkv) via "Email Developer" or tap "Homesoft" from the "About" screen and I try to help.

content: Works great with my nexus products

3 different external hard drives 1 otg cable and it all works with my s4. Tried them with my nexus 7 2nd Gen and nothing works. It only says "none"  on the prompt as if it doesn't recognize my hard drives. Nexus 7 troubleshoot recognizes my otg cable tho. Pls help.   Got it working with a 64gb USB.
replyContent: Hard drives can be tricky.  Try a flash drive.  If it works, most likely the issue is power.  If you contact me via "Email Developer" or tap "Homesoft" from the "About" screen, I can offer some work-arounds.

content: Thank you very much for this App. All is working (I use Nexus 10). Perfect solution. I gave 5+++

Awesome app. Works with all my SD, micro SD and flash drives. I can share my pictures too. No rooting. Now I won't need to take my laptop when I travel. I got an OTG cable for $12 at The Source or RadioShack in the US. Awesome awesome awesome!!!

Now I can't get a refund because I tried it on my phone to see if it was the cable uninstalled both and wasn't given the option. Going to contact Google on this one.
replyContent: Hard drives can be very flaky due to power requirement.  I recommend using a powered USB hub to extend the life of the drive and your phone.  You can read more on the "Developer Website" or contact me via "Email Developer" or tap "Homesoft" from the "About" screen and I try to help.

replyContent: The problem with hard drives is usually power.  If the tablet does not supply enough, you will get disconnects, etc.  Most newer model hard drives 1TB or less will work without power.  That said, it is best to use external power like a powered USB hub.  That will solve nearly all the hard drive issues.

content: All my drives are formatted NTFS, which the S4 cannot read. Nexus Media Importer solves that problem.  With a powered OTG cable, I can import or play/open media files & docs on external SSDs. Flash drives don't need power, just OTG cable. It imports or streams only. Your device must be able to play/display/open the file or stream.  Xlnt file explorer, generates thumbnails, shows file size & date, album & artist.
Video no longer works for the new Android v 4.4.2
Hi, If greyed out to write to your USB go to settings and click on enable write. A generic cd/dvd driver to connect an external cd/dvd player would be nice. Thanks. God bless. Aaron
replyContent: Some Samsung and LG readers support FAT Emulation.  They call it "AV Connectivity" or something similar.  You enable it by open the drive and pressing and holding the eject button until the light comes on.  In this mode, it will work with NMI.  Commercial DVDs are encrypted though...

content: This app is worth every cent! The support has been great.
A good app. But...... why must I always connect  to the net to confirm the licence. It is not always possible for me to have internet all the time. When this is fixed, then 5 stars....
Just need to have a good quality OTG cable. Don't buy a rubbish one - not worth it! Bit tricky to get the idea of the interface, but OK once you do.
Works exactly as described and does what I want it to. No point trying anything that might work this does work!

Just installed this app on my Hisense 7 pro. Works very well although will not play WMA music files but I am very happy with it and the ability to not have to use internal SD card which can't be written to with stock operating system. Good job.
A must have app if you love photography and have a DSLR. The only draw back at the moment is that you have to do a work around to get it working on the N7 2013

content: Hi Dev - I can't export my files from N7 to HDD 1TB anymore. Used to work before. Help please? Or is this a 4.4.2 update issue? Thanks
replyContent: I have not seen any issues with 4.4.2.  Please contact me via "Email Developer" and we can diagnose the issue.

content: Can I choose any program to open file on this apps?
replyContent: You can choose any program that support streaming videos.  Dice Player and BS Player are good choices.

content: Identifies connected external USB but I am unable to open files.

content: As I upgrade my cards, this app is becoming less useful as it does not support larger cards with the exFAT format. I've resorted to using my phone (with native SD card support rather than my Nexus 7 with the importer. Rating would be 5 stars if exFAT were supported.
replyContent: exFAT is a heavily patented proprietary Microsoft file system and is unlikely to be supported in NMI.  If you reformat the cards to FAT32 they should work fine.  On Windows if the card greater than 32GB, you will need a third party utility to do this.  If you contact me via "Email Developer", I can recommend one.

content: Good one

I have bought it and its nice that its detecting pen drives so that we can transfer data without rooting... Also i tried connecting seagate 1 tb external hard disk using otg cable and it worked for me...very nice...

this app is worth every penny. saved me so much hassle. not only can you use it to stream or copy files from usb storage into the android device BUT ALSO THE OPPOSITE WAY! even the protected/hidden files which i peronally wasnt able to dig out of my nexus 7 any better way so far. works even with my SD card reader. just perfect.

content: I had to use the Nexus 10 work around initially but since then it's worked every time. And it seems to be faster and smoother with Kit Kat.

content: I've been using this for more than 6 months on the nexus 7. Really good. I can connect pen drives and sd cards as well using OTG cable. I've not been able to use my 1TB HDD drive though (may be it is because of power issue).. but apart from that its great!

Best $4 you can spend for your Nexus!   Love it!  Thanks!

content: Does not mount my hard drive. I  bought this hoping my nexus 5 would work with it, however, later I found a better app Stickmount - not only does it mount my 2 tera hard drive, it also lets me use my file explorer. No need to say that nexus media importer does not mount the hard drive, and does not let you play files directly from the mounted drive. Wasted money.
replyContent: Stickmount is a great util, but it requires root which may void your warranty.  Due to power issues, hard drives can behave inconsistently with stickmount and NMI. If you are having issues with a hard drive, I recommend a powered USB Hub.  When working properly, NMI should let you play files directly from the drive.

I mostly use the advance options to copy files between the phones built-in memory and the uSD card.  It takes a few minutes to figure out how things work, but once you use it for awhile it is fantastic.  No root needed.

content: Halfway through copying something to my usb stick my phone's screen automatically turned off and the connection was lost, corrupting my entire card
replyContent: NMI acquires a wake lock on the device during transfer to prevent this.  If the card is physically disconnected by during write corruption can occur.

content: This app is ok but would be more useful if it made the otg device visible to other programmes like es explorer or other file managers so you could transfer files directly to it by wifi
replyContent: NMI acts as a plugin for Total Commander.  Most other file manager do not have a plugin architecture and can not be supported.  Please contact their team to ask them for this in the next their next update.

content: A good app for sure. I too had a very inconvenient 'licence check' on a long flight making it completely useless to use until I completed the check. This should NEVER HAPPEN.....! Still feel it is not the most logical way to validate a license
replyContent: The license check should only be run when the app is initially installed.  After that, it should work offline indefinately.  If it has been reinstalled it will need to run again.

content: It would be a 5 star if I could save files from tablet to usb device and not only from usb to tablet.

As read only from NTFS means I feel safe lending drives out whilst they copy few items from them, unlike laptops where they keep using cut & paste (idiots). Money well spent.

replyContent: Export mode is intended to be used to export pictures and videos from the tablet to the USB Device.  NMI looks in standard places for these files.  If the files are hidden or in non-standard places, NMI may not see them.  If this is not helpful, please contact me via "Email Developer" and I'll try to help.

content: By far the most useful app for this device along with great customer service.

content: With new nexus 7, no issues, nice! Thanks, super helpful for the world trip
Why do I need an external 'streamer' to watch something stored on a SD connected via an OTG adapter?  I tried buying but it just sits there
replyContent: Usually a restart will clear up issues with the Android installer.  The issue is that third party apps (like video players) can not see the SD card.  NMI bridges the gap streaming files from its internal web server.

content: One of the most important apps i have.   Works flawlessly.

A few technical notes for the Nexus 7 (2013): If ALL you need to do is view photos, there is a free "Nexus Photo viewer" app. But it will not allow you to copy photos to your device, or edit or delete the contents of your flash drive. This "Nexus Media Importer" will let you copy or delete the contents of the external drive. However, it will only recognize photos, music and videos. It won't even see documents or any other non-media types of file.   This app does NOT mount the flash drive as part of the Nexus file system. It doesn't show up as storage space under system settings, and no other apps can see the contents of the flash drive. You can launch a media player of your choice by selecting a music or video file from your flash drive with this app. But no other apps can see the files by themselves. So this app does NOT, for example, mount the file system and allow you to back up any data to an external flash drive. It ONLY allows you to view, play or copy media type files.  For the moment, I can live with these limitations.  But I really wish that this app would simply mount the flash drive as a fully accessible file system.
Work 100% , thank!!!!

I did have to go thru the troubleshooting step once more, but now I can swap USB devices w/out having to reboot in between.  (on my 2013 Nexus 7 it seems to not be affected by this bug).   BOTTOM LINE:  This is app DEFINITELY worth the money if you want to transfer large files in a timely manner. :o)

If not, please contact me via "Email Developer" and I will investigate.  I have spent many hours looking for an in app. work-around.  I do not believe there is one.

Easy, intuitive piece of software. That is, if you're using Android 4.2. Unfortunately I made the mistake of accepting the prompt to update to 4.3 and this app is now a real pain. The workaround is not time consuming, but it is poor that you should have to disable security and auto-rotate simply to get an app to work. I use my Nexus to back up images in the field, so could really do with security enabled.  Other quibbles would be inability to view RAW images (means you have to shoot in RAW+JPG to use this to preview, lack of thumbnails for video formats (eg MP4), lack of on-screen histogram, EXIF data, or integrated movie viewer although the app will integrated with Real Player et al so I could live with that if it did thumbnails.  I'd rate this 3 stars without the Jellybean bug, 1 with.
replyContent: Disabling the lock screen is optional for the Nexus 10.  It is mostly a matter of random luck on this device.  I believe the N10 should be 100% in the next Android release.  EXIF information is available if you enable "Media Meta Data".  I have considered Video thumbnails, but generating these is very resource intensive.

content: Worked flawlessly when I first bought the app. After my n7 randomly rebooted today the app doesn't work. Tried everything on the developer site and still no go. Hopefully a fix comes soon otherwise I just gave my money away.
replyContent: Couple of ideas.  If you detach the OTG cable while the N7 is sleeping it will behave erratically.  The 2012 enters SOD and 2013 reboots.  If you are not in the US, make sure you set your language to English (United States) when you reboot the N7.

content: Good job, good work, very pleased. Don't stop!!

Works on my Nexus 7 2013 (32gbs, wifi-only). The TRUE value of this app is that I don't have to ROOT my Nexus 7. I tested the free app Nexus Photo Viewer to make sure the concept workson my Nexus, and fortunately everything was OK. So I bought the Nexus Media Importer app. It reads my 64gb FAT32 USB stick perfectly via an OTG cable, and I can transfer files back and forth using the dual-pane interface. I can also do this with the Total Commander app. This file copy capability changes the way I do things with my Nexus 7, e.g. I now carry my OTG cable with me everywhere I go (and a USB hub for SD cards), just in case I need to copy a file that someone passes to me on a memory stick. I no longer need to carry a laptop for this capability. Question: I don't see any procedure for license registration that you mentioned. Am I registered after buying the app?

content: Was installed and working. But, clicked icon said not installed. WTF. Attempt to reinstall says unknown error code during application install -24.  Yet NPV works and installs fine. Stock nexus 7 (2013). Logcat showed permission error, fixed with factory reset.

The user interface has a small learning curve (e.g. in order to save files you need to check a box in the preferences menu, weird). But the developer responds to queries promptly. Perhaps access to a user manual would make it easier for newbs like me. Nonetheless, this app increases the functionality of my Nexus 7 enormously, and is well supported by the developer, so a big 5 from me.

This is the best app ever. Doesn't require root. It's brilliant especially on the nexus 10 because I have this for school work and I can now transfer everything I need to and from my flash drives. its really simple to use and best of all we get all the usable space on the nexus devices.........sweeeet!

via a OTG The advanced tab allows you to copy files between the OTG connected USB drive and the internal storage, and whilst the interface isn't "as standard" as I would have like, it is very easy to use. The trick is to navigate to the folders on both the USB drive and the internal storage, then select one or more files and click on the down arrow icon and select copy.

Worked great until Android 4.3 came out. Now the app does not link to any of my memory sticks on either my Nexus 7 or my Nexus 10. The developer says it's an Android issue. Google says it's the developer's issue. The workaround suggested on the developer's website doesn't work for me.  Before buying this app you need to make sure the free version that only views pictures works for you and that you have updated your device. If your device isn't updated, you won't want to update it to 4.3
replyContent: I'm actually working with one of the Android developers on this issue.  Unfortunately(?) neither of our N10s is affected.  I can reproduce it on my N7 G2, but Google has not released the "Flo" drivers so we can not do a development Android 4.3 build for that device.

content: Good app, but why does it need to start on a reboot? Locks up my phone until I accept it's nonsense or close it. Since I reboot due to blue tooth issues, it happens often. Please give options to stop this... I'll give a 4 then.

Since using this app successfully on my Sprint Samsung Galaxy Note 2, I am unable to connect my phone to any computer. While the phone charges, is does not appear as an attached drive as it did previously. I have tested on several computers and OS's, with different cords, and after pulling the battery with no luck. Uninstalling the app does not appear to resolve the issue.

It works on my nexus 10 and I can plug my lumix G camera straight in with the USB cable.  I find the interface a bit clunky and counter intuitive.  I was hoping to easily sort through my photography shots without using a computer. But it's all a bit awkward with this app.

A great app for downloading music and photo files directly to my Nexus 7	This app has worked perfectly for me. I mainly use it to download image files from my camera to my Nexus 7, so I can view the photos and do edits, mainly while traveling. I also use it to import music files directly to my device, since I hate the Google Music app and its dependance on 'the cloud.' I have also downloaded some PDF files. Takes a bit to figure it out, but it has worked great for me.

I heard good things about this app, so I bought it...then I got some silly license error for the first few times that had me worried that I had wasted my money...but I am currently using it now, and it seems to be reading just find so it's all good. Not sure why but it didn't create a shortcut on my tablet screen.
Worked but now with the update it won't connect. Its just continuous in the connecting tab. Please halp!
Easy to use and works great!
It does not open PDFs (it creates a temporary copy of the PDF file before opening), CHMs (it copies the CHM file to internal storage before opening).
replyContent: Unfortunately, most document readers can not handle a stream and this is the only option to allow them to open the file.

content: ===UPDATE==== Cable was the problem as Dustin from the apps team suggested to me.  Replaced cable.  Works well.  Saved me from buying an iPad.....at least for the moment.  App works great.  Rating changed to 5 stars.  Thanks.
replyContent: The Nexus 7 has a deeper OTG port than most devices and may require a different OTG.  Try the mouse test in the troubleshooting guide on the "Developer Website" link.  That will determine if the cable is compatible or not.

content: Works great. Does exactly what it says. I love it.
I finally found the application that help me connect my Nexus 7 to USB storage.
The answer to a problem I have tried to solve [without rooting] for years. Works on xoom with all the USB memory sticks and cards I have tried. Thank-you.

My initial review was that this item didn't work with my hard drive but I was contacted by the developer who advised that some larger hard drives need more power to function than the nexus can give it. Picked up a USB drive for ¬£15 and it works perfectly, thank you
replyContent: The most likely cause of this that the Nexus 7 is not delivering enough power to hard drive.  As stated in app. description, this can usually be overcome by using a powered USB hub or Nexus 7 dock.  If you are having issues beyond that, please contact me via "E-mail Developer"

content: Excellent! I can now use my flash drive to stream from and to write files to. My 64GB flash drive needed to be formatted to FAT 32 which I did with a program the developer directed me to.  Game controllers also work with the OTG cable but this program really adds to the tablet usefulness. The developer is very responsive.
Was good to start......now doesn't work. :-(  Uninstalled, reinstalled as it asked.......nothing.  Better luck next time guys.
Works perfectly. Don't have to root my nexus 7 now. Well worth the money just to save time!
Works and i can use it with my s4 and 1tb hdd thanks!

I can't transfer files from my tablet to a pen drive. I have scratched my head but I can't seem to find a way around this problem. I didn't encounter any problems while transferring files either way on my galaxy S4. Other than that this app is great.
replyContent: You may need to just "Enable Write" in the Preferences.  If that does not work, please contact me via "E-mail Developer"

content: Works like a charm with the Nexus 7. Thought there was no option to write to the external drive, but actually it does support it for FAT drives.. Just enable under preferences.
Since the new update this junk program is not working. Rip OFF! Update: working again.

Whilst I appreciate your response, how many people read technical notes, or even understand them? It's like Terms and Conditions, nobody does. Even now I don't understand what your explanation means. It's like having a car, I know what it does, I don't need to know why.
replyContent: As listed in the description under "Technical Notes", the app. will transfer both ways for FAT/FAT32, but is read only for NTFS.

content: Brilliant app
Very good for the money... Could be cheaper
Excellent!
Good

I think this is the worst app I have downloaded so far.  No trouble downloading and installing and hardware checks out OK.  After some difficulty and watching some videos on YouTube I finally managed to load all the photos from an SD card.  The User Interface  to do this was not very intuitive in my opinion.  What I really wanted to do was to copy the selected images into a specific folder on my Nexus.  So far I have been unable to work out how to do this and there are no instructions at all to help.  The developer's web site is next to useless for help.  I have now  uninstalled the app and will rely entirely on transferring via my PC, which is less convenient but very simple and reliable.  Arthur Locke.
replyContent: The default are set to make it easy for new users, but may not be suitable for advanced users.  You can enable "Multi-Select" from the menu.  If you deselect "Default Save Locations" in the preferences, you will be prompted where to save the files.

content: The one time I want to use this app is on a flight.  I open the app and get a license error that states I must connect to the internet.  The flight had no internet and why should I have to pay for it just to license this app?  Next time I'll just use air droid before I leave and will not purchase anything from Homesoft again.
replyContent: As of version 6, the software requires a license check on the first opening.  After that it will work offline indefinitely.  This app. description has been updated to reflect this.

content: ...well worth the price you pay. If you don't want to root your tablet/phone for USB OTG functionality, this is the app to use!
replyContent: Hard drives can sometime require more power than the tablet can deliver.  They can be very fickle.  The recommend approach is to use a powered USB hub.  Also, please make sure the tablet is charged to 100%.

content: Does what it says. Absolutely no problems and does not need the nexus rooted. Thanks to the developer(s)

What's not to like?....app once install allows both read and writes on both source and target devices.  Takes just moments to use and worth the few dollars short of having to root your tablet.  Developer as mentioned responds back very quickly usually with that same day. EBay OTG cables required also with this app so be sure and order a few...they are real cheap so order  a few of them. Microsoft Office files no longer a issue with this and one added app....life is good once again!  Thanks Dustin

Got my N7 this morning, installed this app, connected an OTG cable bought from ebay and a USB stick. Worked! without a problem. Have tried two sticks and a card reader with an 8GB micro SD card. All worked perfectly. Probably the best utility application for the N7..............just need to get it working on my HOX!
It work nicely on flash drive to view pictures, play videos and musics.
no issues for me yet using nexus7.  great app

Firstly great app for Nexus 7 owners with limited storage. Works well BUT just got off a cross Atlantic flight where app refused to open as it could not verify the certificate for use as there was no wifi. All my programming was on a thumb drive, so I was locked out. 6.5 hours of grinding teeth ! Great. Mr Developer, I paid for this app, I expect it to work at my convenience not yours. Your issues with certification are not mine, plus I am sure that anyone who knows what they are doing could circumvent it a
replyContent: As of version 6, the license check is only required once and then works offline indefinitely.  There is also a 24 hour grace period for new users.  If this is not the case, please contact me via "E-mail Developer" and we will work through it.

content: played ripped movies with no problem . only tested avi format so far
Keeps saying it can't install to SD card, but whyyyyyy? WHAT DO YOU WANT FROM ME?
replyContent: This is an Android issue.  Press and Hold the Power button until you see "Power Off"  Follow the prompts.  It will install after the restart.  If this does not resolve the issue, please contact us via "E-mail Developer"

content: Was OK but stopped working can't read partision
replyContent: As of V5.2 NMI detects and rejects invalid partitions.  The can usually be resolved by fixing the partition.  Please contact us via "E-mail Developer" to resolve this.

content: Rubbish for traveling or holidays, only works for 24 hours without internet connection	Terrible for my trip to China as it stopped working altogether as it could not authenticate.   Had to download a cracked apk just to properly use something I had already paid for!
replyContent: You need to open it once on Wifi to verify the license.  After that, you should not get this again.

content: Exactly what I needed. Great programme at a great price

When I transfer files from my tab to a pen drive, it moves them rather than copying them.... What do I do? Is this the intended function or is there any way to copy files from the tab onto the pen drive?
replyContent: There are two icons.  One is square with an arrow, that is Move.  The other is two squares on top of each other, that is Copy.

content: Whenever I try to download pictures from my SD card it just comes up with a mass storage reset message and will not download it. This is really frustrating and makes me wish I bought the iPad instead :-(
replyContent: This is probably a loose connection or an incompatible reader.  Please "E-mail Developer" and we can try to diagnose the issue.

content: Thank you for this great app! I just opened a beer.... Here's to you! :-)

It seems to work perfectly with my  32gb key but says the 64gb is "unsupported". Is this correct? Happy to upgrade to 5 if the larger key works?  Any chance of an answer please?  Still had no answer?  Not very encouraging? I'm reducing my score to one star until I get a response.
replyContent: It works with 64GB if it is formatted as FAT32 or NTFS.  EaseUS Partion Master will format drives >32GB to FAT32.

content: An excellent app, very fast and easy to use. Now allows both read and write. Wish it played .ogm movies directly from the USB though.
Didn't want to root by tablet but had already bought a OTG cable, came across this app and I am 100% happy. Thank you!
Bought it for my Nexus 7, even works on my GT-i9305. What more could I ask for :)

Just bought this app to go with my newly purchased Nexus 10. It worked faultlessly. I can copy and stream without difficulty. I can also transfer files from my Nexus 10 to my USB stick easily. I have tried it with both 32gb and 64gb pen drives as well as using a card reader. All devices were FAT32. Highly recommended.

Nice app when it's working, but have used a number of micro usb to female usb adapters to plug memory sticks/card readers into and has a habit of dropping the connection, so no good for watching films etc, you just need to copy them to the nexus to avoid mid film interruptions....  Update: was a lot more stable until the last update. I'd there anyway for buffering films and if the connection is lost auto reconnect to avoid stuttering?
replyContent: The software does attempt to reconnect upon losing a connecting.  Sometimes the USB device stops responding and only a disconnect will restore the connection.  Sometimes these disconnects are caused by a bad cable.

content: Great bit of kit for the price - work straight away:-0
very useful.
Good to see more updates :)  Also people havening trouble with HD video crackle us MXvideo it's the best for video playback for Nexus so fare
What a grt app bought otg cable and a usb multicard reader put and old  m2 memory card from  Sony walkman phone hooked it up to my nexus 7 worked perfectly
Ideal for my Nexus 7 when combined with a USB OTG and hard drive

Perfect and easy to use app. The app automatically opens when you plug in a USB drive and you can select which type of file to view across different tabs. It pays movies perfectly with the standard video player, however the BS Player app stutters when playing videos.
This is exactly what I was looking for and it does precisely what it says. ¬£2 for a USB to Go cable plus this and, for less than a fiver, my Nexus 7 now feels complete. Thanks, devs!

I have installed the Nexus Media Importer on my Nexus 7. The installation was successful and i got the icon. But when i connect a USB OTG, it is not recognized.  Can some one help in addressing this problem.
replyContent: Please try the trouble shooting guide on the "Developer Website".  If that does not work, contact us via the "Email Developer" link and we'll help you work through the issue.

content: I'm no tech wiz so to be able to load this app, rather than trying to follow instructions to root the device. Then  connect a cable to watch a video from a USB is great. I don't have to take up internal storage with something I am likely to only watch once.

When my wife and I went away on holiday I was able to use this app to give her extra space for her photos when she used up her card - That's just one example, this app has always worked a charm. Although I would like to see exFAT support, as it can't read my (obscenely high capacity) SD card, and I'd love to be able to hook my tablet up to my printer and print from it through this app... Probably a long shot on that one, eh?
replyContent:
The exFAT drive can be reformatted as FAT32 and it should work then.

Unfortunately, printers use is a completely different set of protocols.

content: I have a 32 GB SD card attached to a reader and I love that I know have enough storage space on my nexus 7.

‚Ä¢ The Nexus 7 is a GREAT machine and this app covers its main weakness... No sd card reader. BUT with this app, and an almost unnoticeable low profile 32G USB Flash Drive on the end of an USB OTG adapter and you instantly have all kinds of memory to view EPUB's, PDF's, MP3's and Videos.

with this application I can open vidoes, docs etc. from pendrive easily and no longer worried about the limited storage on my device (32gb). one of the best nexus 7 applications out there... worth every bit of the money...
Great job Dev. Keep up the Great work!
Good
Worth the purchase, dev updates it all the time and it is now pretty much perfect! Handles my RAW and JPEG files seamlessly
Brilliant

I just opened a brand new 64gb SD card, and copied a bunch of files over to it just to see the unsupported filesystem error. Bummer.   Five stars since I've used this app with supported filesystems, and so I know it works very well. :-)

Great app for long trips or for media consumption in area with no WiFi. I hooked it up with 6 Gigs of music and mp4 movie rips and it worked great. There did not seem to be a big hit on battery life. Please note- as stated above the works well on my nexus 7 and galaxy nexus BUT NOT on the Nexus 4 I have. The app works fine but the nex 4 does not support this

What can I say?!  Exactly what ALL nexus 10, Or any other supported device, needs!  Can't speak for others but so far app works 100% of the time no errors..The WRITE feature is brilliant and makes my $525.00 nexus 10 priceless to me!!  Keep it up devs!! AMAZING WORK!!   Thanks for all the hard, complicated work!!

While on my last flight, I had some movies on my usb stick and when I plugged it in, the app did not start, prompting me to connect to the internet tox verify some whatever license. Why? I used it before and it worked perfect... I was not able to use it the whole flight.
replyContent: Unfortunately, the licensing code from V5 is not compatible with the new unlimited offline mode in V6.  You need to open the app once on Wifi with V6 to us it offline.  Please see the "Developer Website" link -> Licensing Issues link for more information.

content: I have a GoPro Hero Black which has a 64Gb micro SD card. NMI doesn't recognise the Hero 3. So I tried a workaround to put the card into a USB card reader. NMI recognises USB device but errors with 0: 27.GB No First Partition. Going diving in a couple of days so a quick fix would be really appreciated, then 5 stars.
replyContent:
exFAT support is unlikely.  Microsoft has made it impossible to create an open exFAT implementation without violating their patents.  Please see the Wikipedia entry for exFAT, "Disadvantages" section for more information.

FYI:  No first partition usually means that the card is not partitioned properly.

content: It looks like the developer has fixed this issue. Therefore I have changed my review to 5 stars.
replyContent: Unlimited offline use can be enabled by opening the app on Wifi before getting on the plane.  Please see the "Developer Website" link and Troubleshooting -> Licensing Issues for more info.

content: This app. have solved a lot of problems. It does what it says and it is fast and stable. UI could be a bit more user friendly though. Still 5 stars. :-)
HTC one - not supported
replyContent: The list of supported devices is stated in the app. description.  If you are unsure if your device is supported, please try the free Nexus Photo Viewer first.  Device support is determine by the hardware and new devices can not be added with changes to the software.

content: This new license check is a real bummer. I work offshore and don't always have access to an internet connection. The developer needs to rectify this problem in a future update ASAP!!
replyContent: This problem has been addressed in Version 6.  Please see the "Developer Website" link and Troubleshooting -> Licensing Issues for more info.

content: You can add support for Mvideoplayer because is single one with sub/idx support

Needed an app that would let me transfer both ways between my nexus 7 and sd cards. I emailed the developer and confirmed it will do just what I want. I checked the option to "Enable Write" in preferences and now am able to copy or move any file I've tried from my sd card to my n7 as well as from my n7 to my sd card. I was even able to select a folder and move the folder and all it's contents (71 files) in one operation. The app also does all the media stuff others have mentioned.

I just wanted to import photos and videos from my camera SD card while on holidays. Unfortunately, while my photos import and are viewable in the gallery, it seems the Exif date field gets overwritten at import time which screws up the ordering of my photos. And then the videos don't show up in the gallery which means I can't share them since I can't find them except using MX Player.  At least they are backed up though.
replyContent: The EXIF date is not modified, but file modified date is set to today.  Unfortunately, it is not possible to set the modified date in Android on a non-rooted device.  The MOV videos not natively supported by Android.  Google "Android Supported Video Formats" for more information.  You may still be able to share them with the share feature in NMI.

content: App + OTG cable adds a whole new level of functionality to the Nexus 7 for dirt cheap (one could conceivably get things up and running for $5.00 or so, as OTG cables can be found that cost less than the app, itself).  The ONLY improvement I can think of would be the ability to write to an external storage device...I'd gladly make a donation to the developer if he made that happen.  =)
replyContent: If the device is formatted as FAT/FAT32, you can "Enable Write" and write to the device.

content: It disconnects a lot.
replyContent: This is probably a bad/loose OTG cable, or possibly a hard drive that is not getting enough power.  Please contact us on the e-mail developer link for more help.

content: I've bought this app and realized that it doesn't really work how i expected. It crashes all the time when i transfer photos from my camera to my nexus 10, e.g. when i transfer 50 photos it transfers 1 or 2 and crashes saying that there are connection problems. I have copied music from my phone to tablet that worked quite well only thing - tablet stuck and i had to wait wile it came out of freeze, maybe there could be made some optimization to not freeze device. Also i had many messages in notification thread, why? I dont want notification for each song i have transfered. Also these notifications stuck in notification tray even when i removed all of them with new transfer all other notifications appeared. I solved this by deleting cache of download manager. I hope you will have improvements to these things in near future, thank you.
replyContent: Please use the Android crash report system to submit the crash and I'll look into it.

content: I was hoping to directly connect my Nikon D3100 or my S3 but neither was recognized.  According to the troubleshooting guide, this was to be expected though.  It would be nice if I didn't have to buy an otg cable, card reader, and remove memory so hopefully will be updated in the future.   This is a quality app and excellent that it does not require root.
Just what was looking for. Ability to play video from USB . Highly recommend!!

I can't use this on my nexus 10 with app share. This means my GF (the only other account on here) can't use it on her login. I understand the need to safe guard your property but this essentially says buy it twice for the same tablet... Could be handled differently.    However, this app deserves 5 stars as it does exactly what's advertised and I've yet to find a fault. Please consider changing the licencing to something, multiuser though. I have many licenced apps that work great for all users of my tablet and this app would be perfect if it did the same

Very good app but whenever I play a video from my USB stick and then try to view a photoset it won't allow me to fling my way through a set or enlarge a pic.  I've  found that I needed to uninstall an DC then reinstall the app a few times already today.
Works great on the Hisense Sero 7 Pro that I just bought.
Works well on my galaxy nexus. Good job

Bought this the first day I got my n7 back in August , has been fantastic and now I'm able to copy from usb stick to n7 this is the icing on the cake.  Sorry I didn't review earlier, keep up the great updates.

Can't say enough good things about this app.  Easy to use and as an amateur photographer, the support of RAW files is a great addition.  Very impressed with all of the functionality.  Once write to NTFS volumes are supported, it's all I could ask for.
I use this all the with cards from my Nikon, which I only shoot RAW with... highly recommend this app!

Initially I gave it 5 stars. I have just traveled to some countries where I had no wifi. Without wifi the application would not work!!! :( After the Google guys have disabled the USB on the go, now this application would stop working when you really need it. That is a shame. It seems that the only solution to really use the USB anywhere you like is to root the tablet. Very polite, the developer said "Version 6 will only require you to activate it once per install.".  That would make it perfect so I have to give it 5 stars back. :) Unlimited offline use after license activation now! Yuppy!
replyContent:
It will work without Wifi for up to two weeks if you activate first.  

I have heard you loud and clear.  Version 6 will only require you to activate it once per install.

content: Great

use this to play movies from my hard drive on my nexus 10 all the time - amazing :)

Great app works perfectly.  Only improvement I would like to see is if it could also play or link to a music player that played WMA files - eg poweramp.
Excellent (N10)

This app is excellent. Nothing fiddly to mess with and it works a treat. Perfect
Great app
Great app
I dont know how to use it.

content: Works perfectly so far. Constant updates keeps it fresh. A must have app for nexus user.

It's a great app. It is constructed well, and gives me so much more freedom with what I can bring with me. The read/write features are amazing.
Its working well

content: I bought this for connecting my nexus 7 to my hard drive and it certainly does work but I think it is a bit expensive for what it does. Overall if you need to transfer data or view photos, videos listen to music or view documents from a USB device this is a great app.
Perfect app. !!
This is by far the most needed app for android devices without an ext sd card.
Great app; I use it all the time. It gives greater flexibility and function to the Nexus 7. I This app should be on every Nexus.
Works great, I've rooted my nexus so I could use a USB storage but since 4.2.2. it need rooting again. But that takes to long, so this is a brilliant app.

Works well with my Nexus 7 and HTC One X+

I've tried every app to get my external hard drive working on my sgs4 and this is the only one which works. Now have my 500gb hdd connected without an external power source and it works flawlessly. The world needs to know about this, absolutely fantastic.

I use to like this because i could take a flash drive and watch my movies off of it or transfer stuff without a computer. content: Great app!

content: I wanted to be able to take my daughters movies on a plane with me and the other USB solutions all required root. This one just worked right out of the box, can play movies right off the sdcard. Excellent app!

content: Works straight away. Pity about the repeating silly license check, but other than that this app is really handy. Worth my money. Cheers guys

content: Works great.

I give 5 stars to this app. Could not live without it !.  As a photographer I need to have a user selectable filter applied on filetypes especially to ignore RAW files. Examples *.*  (default) *.jpg, jpeg, etc  Background. Cards often contain a RAW and JPEG files for various reasons.  When needing to view jpeg quickly and clearly have raw files appearing in the folder and slideshow is very annoying. Easily resolved and implemented for sure.
Perfect app, thanks guys, works great on my nexus 7 and galaxy s3. Keep making apps like this and ill keep buying ;) haha

At this rate, my Nexus 7 will become my main computer while at uni...

Works great but, the periodic license check has to go away. Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars. Why the check if I'm a paying customer? Why not have *one* licence check after the app is installed if you're so concerned about piracy? Or check the license once per month AND give the end user a warning indicating that they need to connect to the internet within X days to check the license before disabling. (Although this would be bad as well, but better than it is now) In any case, you have to come up with something better than disabling the functions.
Works perfectly!

Well I am going to give it 0 stars even though I can not get it to work on my 2 month old Nexus 7.  I have tried several USB Drives and the app does not launch automatically.  Also, when I manually launch the app it tells me "CONNECT  Select Source: None Found.   So the app doesn't work..at all.  In conclusion.  8 different USB Drives tried, latest one I got on May 5th, 2013 and none work.  Is it worth throwing away money I many never know. . tried everything developer suggested.  OTG cable is wworkingg.  I booted rebooted.  Installed and uninstalled nothing worked and an hour wasted.
replyContent: Bad OTG cables are the usual culprit.  Please click the Troubleshooting Guide button on the Connect screen.  That will help you determine if the cable is good.  If you are still stuck, contact us via the Email Developer link.

content: So if your internet is down, the app won't work!
100 percent Recommended .
replyContent: The notification is created by Android asking permission for NMI to access the device.  If you are not getting it, Android is not seeing the device and NMI will not work.  There is a Troubleshooting button on the Connect screen with tips.  If you are still stuck, please contact us via the "Email Developer" link.

content: Works a treat
The OTG cable is quite cheap, so do not hesitate.
D
Please hurry up and make it so I can export media to a USB. Then this app will get 5 stars!
replyContent: This function is available for FAT formatted drives.  Enable Write from the Preference.  From the Connect screen, select Exporter in the upper right.

content: Just got my OTG cable in the mail.  App is amazing.  Made my Nexus 7 even better now with unlimited memory.  Used in conjuction with a file manager app i can now read and write files

replyContent:
On the Advanced tab, pressing and holding the folder will select it.  Then you will be able to copy it.

To show/hide the folders in Photo view, click the arrow button.  Drag is not implemented.

I've only used it today and when I plugged in my N7 afterwards, system said it was charging, but the battery kept discharging, albeit at a slower rate than unplugged. A restart fixed it, but haven't started NMI to see if the issue comes back. Also, do you think an external 1.8 inch hard drive could be powered by the Nexus7 directly? I ask as I have an old PMP with a 160GB hard drive and was thinking of buying an 1.8 HDD enclosure to have a small, high capacity storage drive to store videos for the N7 while traveling. Most 1.8 HDD require around 3.3-3.5V and 500mA or less, so about 1.75W which is less than the 2.5W required by the USB standard, 5V x 500mA. But I don't know if the N7 can put out 500mA.

I had email exchanges last fall with developer Dustin requesting that he provide "write to USB" as well as the existing "read from USB," and he said he was developing this for a spring release. Well, it's spring and Release 5.0 does exactly as he promised. Wow! This makes my GN7 a total travel solution. I can upload photos from my camera to the GN7 and then save them to a separate SDHC card for safe keeping. Before I'd upload AND leave on the camera, but now I can erase the camera card. I never want files (or photos) only in one place in case of accident or problems. The GN7 is now my travel computer, Kindle, and file saver. One more neat feature - you can read and write by folder, not just by file. If I could give Dustin 6 stars I would!

Got my N7 for Christmas and immediately started looking for a way to access more stuff on the road which meant more storage. After purchasing the app I had some issues but I sent an email to the developer and within 8 hrs (on a weekend no less) had a response with some instructions for what I wanted to to do (basically access playlists for my music library). The instructions got me going, and though not perfect for what I had hoped for (hence the 4 stars instead of 5), I now have access to my 100GB+ music library on a Centron 128GB USB stick ($64 at Tiger Direct). Toss in two Kingston 64GB USB sticks ($27 ea.) with videos and I am set for long road trips, flights, or just watching a TV show on the fly. Couple of notes for the one star reviewers. Read the troubleshooter for sure. I too found certain OTG cables did not work and so I purchased the recommended Amazon cable for about $3 (shipping included). After that I have not had a USB stick fail yet. My hope to get a powered 1TB usb drive running. The dvlpr states (at least as of my getting the app) that these are not supported at this time.

Updating my review. Wow, he did it! Amazing work man. Awesome awesome job.  ------------------------------------------------ Edit: I'm editing this because I am noticing that there are a few people having issues with certain flash drives or maybe USB-OTG cables.  I use this app with a QQ-Tech¬Æ Micro  USB Host Mode Cable (OTG Cable) bought from Amazon for 0.98 cents. I have tested it with the following flash drives: SanDisk Cruzer Fit 16 GB USB Flash Drive; Kingston Data Traveler G3 32gb USB Flash Drive, and about 3 off-brand flash drives and it has worked with each and every one. It did NOT work with one of the off brands at first but, the dev tweaked and updated the app and now every drive we have works.   We only use this app for movies so, that's all I can speak on. What has worked so far for us: .mp4, .mkv, and .wmv. From 1080p to 720p Handbraked to get the files down to about 1.5-2.5 GB. -------------------------------------------------Truly helpful developer, amazing app support. This is the kind of developer we need more of.

This app is just what I was looking for ! After recently purchasing a Samsung Note 2 (16 GB), I was looking forward  to play videos from the micro SD card slot. I was quickly disappointed to find out the Note 2 did not support NTFS partitions and the files size was therefore limited to 4 GB, which is fine for TV shows but often a problem for high quality movies.  I don't want / can't root my device so I was delighted when I finally found this app and it worked ! Using a 4$ OTG cable bought online and a 32 gb usb flash drive, I can now watch videos without re-encoding them to a max of 4 GB or having to split the files ! This is awesome !  I suggest trying the free Nexus Photo Viewer to test the compatibility of your device first. It did the trick for me !  Great work devs !

(2) Mime type error (eg jpeg opens with UPnPlayer as cover art, not with gallery or ES Viewer).  (3) Awkward cut copy paste ops.  SUGGESTION: Collaborate with EStrongs.  Use your connectivity know how.  Use everything else from them.

A plus

I read about the Nexus 7 USB OTG capabilities so I wanted to test it for myself. I purchased a USB OTG cable for under 5 bucks and this app. The cable arrived today. So I plugged it in and connected a 8 GB thumb drive. The app had no problems in detecting the thumb drive and scanning it for files. So for giggles, I decided to try a 250 GB USB drive. Shockingly, the app detected it, and started scanning for files. The USB drive light blinked and all that. It ran slower then normal, as it was probably not fully powered. The battery didn't seem to drain all that fast either.  But the next time, I'll geta powered USB hub, to access my large USB drives.  The only thing that is disappointing, is that I can't save to my USB thumb drive or USB hard drive. It would be nice if I was able to do that, but no worries. A decent app, thank you.
Really great if you don't want to void your warrenty and root your device, works great on Galaxy Nexus. Why is this not a default app Google? ;)

I bought this app so that I could get more immediate use out of the pictures from my Canon 20d.  I purchased the Samsung USB connector which allows me to attach my compact flash card reader to my Galaxy Nexus, and this app allows me to view and transfer the pictures from my compact flash card to my Galaxy Nexus.  Now I don't have to wait until I am at my computer to view/edit and share my pics from my DSLR.
Seems to work as described!

I was about to write a scathing review "I am quite disappointed with this app.  It worked a week ago with an .mkv - Now it seems to require more software (paid?) to run.  Seriously? I am not sure if this was the developers intent, or was forced by Google.  Please let me know when it work again.  Thanks."  However, I was cleaning up my Nexus 7 (I thought) and removed MX Media player.  That was what (I was using and) is needed to play that file type (as well as .avi - well, upon checking, *some* .avi).  I just bought 2 32GB Kingston USB  DataTraveler drives for media.  So. FYI. Download the MX Media Player (free) and change your audio decoding to S/W if your media is in DTS/5.1 or whatever.  I might update this to figure out what the issue is with other .avi files.

Does just what it says.. Runs fine on my Xoom running Jelly Bean 4.1.2 It's particularly useful that root is not required thereby allowing for further over the air android updates as and when they arrive.

Works on nexus 7 using SD card reader and USB stick. And I have the flashing light. Got otg cable from Amazon. No need to root.

This app does exactly what it claims. It allows a stock (i.e. non-rooted) Nexus 7 to read material via a Micro USB OTG to USB adapter plugged into the Nexus charging (micro USB) port. It classifies the material by type (Docs, video, music, etc.) and allows reading & streaming. This effectively expands the Nexus storage capacity and allows you to carry essentially unlimited media with you. The USB adapters range from less than $1.00 to the $4 or $5.00 range. I picked a middle of the road adapter on Amazon and have had no issues whatsoever. The price is a real bargain for the storage capacity capabilities gained.

Great app! Can read my external hard drive contents on my nexus 7 and doesn't need root. Well done guys! Giving 5 stars but would be really happy to see streaming of multiple files so you can read the whole folder of pictures or play music! Thanks again for awesome app!

The Nexus Media Importer app is essential if you want to transfer your own files to your Nexus 7, from a USB stick or memory card (connected to a card reader). With the ability to select multiple files, & transfer them all at once, it really couldn't be any simpler. The app also comes with a built in media preview window, and also allows you to stream content from your connected device.  A USB OTG cable is required. I'd also recommend a file manager app, for deleting viewed files from your Nexus 7.

I was looking for a way to get access to additional media files on my Nexus 7 (8 Gb), but didn't want to root the device. This app was highly recommended on Android Central, and with good reason - it is excellent. Good appearance, easy to use, and a responsive developer. Top marks!

Thanks for fixing something that Google and ASUS should have included. Works fine with a $.75 OTG cable from Amazon and a 32GB Patriot Thumb Drive. Google, don't be an Apple, fix this in an update to the Nexus 7 ROM so we can mount external file systems natively. Needs directory import.

I don't have to save movie files so hopefully you can do the same with EPUB and PDF's. I have not tested MP3's yet. I would glady pay more for this feature.

Mixed feeling about this App.  When connected to Xoom before booting , the usb flash drive is read and all files appear ok.  However if I select DISCONNECT from app menu, the usb flash drive contents disappear and message appears "waiting for media" -  leaving the usb flash drive connected and  selecting SCAN again from App will re-read usb flash drive again Ok.  However I had expected that the usb flash drive could be changed by using the DISCONNECT selection from App menu, swopping flash drive and  again SCAN contents - this is not the case - nothing happens except drive details show at top of screen, but not content directory, and pressing SCAN again locks whole app.  In order to get the app working again, I have to reboot the xoom.  While the ability to read one flash drive is useful and on the XOOM better than nothing , the need to reboot completely to change a flash drive is disappointing and annoying. Nexus 7.  Will import pictures IF you use the right card reader.  Lucky over the years I have collected a lot of 12 in one and 23 in one readers.  No sense in putting brand names out here because no doubt the manufacturers have gone out of business by now BUT after a half hour of trial and error I cobbled together a little choo-choo train that worked.  A USB OTG cable, a USB to mini USB cable to the card reader, a Micro SD adapter, and finally the micro SD card itself.  Kensington reader 23 in one failed, Dane Elec worked (that is the reader).  Sanyo 4g micro SD card.  It imports the pictures to folder PICTURES on the Nexus, btw.  So, pleased in that I have the right combo of stuff in the junk drawer to rise to this magnificent technological achievement!  Good luck to you.  Keep trying.

At first I had some problems with this app not reading my thumb drive. It turns out it was the thumb drive itself. Drives are mounted to a root folder called  usbstorage and is only accessible via a root file browser. This app allows non rooted users to access the media in this directory. Great app for non rooted uses however it's unnecessary for rooted devices. Thought you should know before buying this app like i did.

Brilliant concept badly flawed; only shows some files and no directories	It's a great solution to address the abysmal 2003-style storage of the Nexus. Looking forward to major upgrade of program.

Thanks to the developer for delivering what the consumers want and need for Nexus 7 and other devices.

I shoot with a Canon EOS 50D camera which uses CF card storage. App had no problems viewing photo, mp3, various doc files using generic OTG cable and 16GB Sandisk Cruzer flash drive. However, would not display any of the video files on the drive because they were unrecognized format/extension (in this case, .mpg and .vob). I had expected this from earlier reviews, but assumed I would at least have option to copy the files and use another media streamer to view. Unfortunately, this app didn't even show the files as present on the drive, so copy was not an option. Hopefully, the promised file manager / folder view will rectify this shortcoming. If the file is cannot be streamed by the app, it should always provide option to copy the file. Ideally, if app can't handle format, it should present you with a list of other installed media streamers to use - like the ES File Explorer File Manager app does. It gets 3 stars because it does what the developer says it will do, i.e. - read selected file types from USB drive without rooting. I'll give it 4 stars when I can view/copy any file on a USB drive. 5 stars when I can write files to a USB drive.
Works like a charm for me. Interface needs some redesign but as far as functionality concerns, no complains at all

btw, other file types Can be read by the app if you temporarily rename the file's suffix to a type that the media importer can read.  Just be sure and rename it back to it's original name before opening - for transfer only of course.  I transferred a 2 Gb Wikipedia archive this way.  I'm really thankful to the developer of this app, got my N7 with faith that something like this would become available,  looking forward to even more functionality with future updates.

Works perfectly when combined with a decent media player. I'm sure the interface will improve over time, offering folders etc but for now makes the size of the nexus 7 a non issue, meaning it's now a perfectly tablet. This app would be worth paying for, up to ¬£3 in my opinion

As others have stated, this product is an awesome application for importing/streaming certain types of files from a USB memory stick.  However, for each type of data that is displayed (photos, videos, music, docs) only certain types of files are displayed.  For example, for videos, .MP4 videos will be shown (and thus can be imported or streamed) while .MPG videos will not appear and thus cannot be accessed. A further "general" file type that shows everything would solve this problem.  So if you care about a specific type of file, be sure that suffix is supported.  If available, I would have given the app 4.5 stars, but if your file types are available or you can convert to one of the supported types (I can convert MPG to MP4) then the app is fantastic.
Finally, there is a no root solution for for USB file hosting.  Works great.

This can be used to transfer any type of file which can at times be useful. excellent does what it says on the tin - and best of all not silly priced
Worked first go

Ok u can't currently charge and use an otg mass storage device at same time, but that may come, else with this app you can view your huge vid collection or camera pics straight off external storage no root or lenghty copying across. That is a good thing.  Responsive developer. Great utility.
Works great on my nexus 7. No need to root.

Excelente app, no hay necesidad de "root" la tablet. Me gusta como la app te diferencia entre musica, fotos, v√≠deos y documentos. La app te permite "stream" o bajarlos a la tablet. Totalmente vale la pena

Plugged in my GE 500X camera last night and could look through the pictures via my Nexus 7, brilliant. I will be travelling soon and need to keep things light so being able to take photos then view on a decent screen and then upload to the cloud it awesome.. Would be even better if I could multi select and upload to drop box/sky drive etc. directly from the app (just a though). Love the regular updates and just would like to thank the developer for a brilliant piece of work!

You can use this on Nexus 7 to access media, and now Doc and PDFs, on USB drive! This does NOT require root and is a simple way to access extra movies, audio, or photo files when you do not have WiFi. Very responsive developer, has now added documents and streaming video!

Glad I stuck with it, this app is really useful for me, never written a review before but thought I should for this one. Only improvement could be if I were able to make the files on the USB drive viewable in their folders etc,  don't know if that's possible,  or allow a playlist to be made, apart from that, brilliant!!

Great potential for this app. Let's me stream video and download documents off USB. It does crash when I choose to download a doc, but the file still saves in the downloads folder. Basically, it does what I need...going on a trip and wanted to bring a USB stick with movies on it. Unlocking for root wipes the device, so that's not an option at this point.
Would be nice if there was a select all option though for import :-)
Does exactly what it says with no problems at all. Would be good to have 'select all" but great work in progress. Was just about to route so saved me a job.  Keep up the good work.

I can finally get files off my USB thumb easily.  My use... I have a number of videos on my thumb drive.  Copy the ones I want to watch, delete when done.  A bit disjointed... but quite awesome all the same. No Root!
